page.title: 12150 Years of Stutton School
page.content: For a week in July, Stutton School turned the clock back to 1835 to celebrate its 150th Anniversary. We dressed in Victorian clothes and followed the curriculum of that time. We had drill, copywriting, reciting of tables, arithmetic, religious instruction and maypole dancing. On the Tuesday, television and press cameras were buzzing around us. We walked from school to the church where we met the Bishop who led a service of thanksgiving for the school. The dinners at school were nice. We had gruel, ham, pickled cabbage, bread and cheese. The tables were set in lines. We were not supposed to talk. There was an exhibition in the school hall with lots of photographs, pictures, clothes and other items from the last 150 years. This was a very exciting week.
